verses.text: Fields shall be bought for money, and deeds shall be signed and sealed and witnessed, in the land of Benjamin, in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the Shephelah, and in the cities of the Negeb; for I will restore their fortunes, declares the LORD."

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to Jeremiah a second time, while he was still shut up in the court of the guard:

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:2
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD who made the earth, the LORD who formed it to establish it- the LORD is his name:

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:3
verses.text: Call to me and I will answer you, and will tell you great and hidden things that you have not known.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:4
verses.text: For thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city and the houses of the kings of Judah that were torn down to make a defense against the siege mounds and against the sword:

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:5
verses.text: They are coming in to fight against the Chaldeans and to fill them with the dead bodies of men whom I shall strike down in my anger and my wrath, for I have hidden my face from this city because of all their evil.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:6
verses.text: Behold, I will bring to it health and healing, and I will heal them and reveal to them abundance of prosperity and security.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:7
verses.text: I will restore the fortunes of Judah and the fortunes of Israel, and rebuild them as they were at first.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:8
verses.text: I will cleanse them from all the guilt of their sin against me, and I will forgive all the guilt of their sin and rebellion against me.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:9
verses.text: And this city shall be to me a name of joy, a praise and a glory before all the nations of the earth who shall hear of all the good that I do for them. They shall fear and tremble because of all the good and all the prosperity I provide for it.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:10
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD: In this place of which you say, 'It is a waste without man or beast,' in the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem that are desolate, without man or inhabitant or beast, there shall be heard again

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:11
verses.text: the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voices of those who sing, as they bring thank offerings to the house of the LORD: "' Give thanks to the LORD of hosts, for the LORD is good, for his steadfast love endures forever!' For I will restore the fortunes of the land as at first, says the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:12
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD of hosts: In this place that is waste, without man or beast, and in all of its cities, there shall again be habitations of shepherds resting their flocks.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:13
verses.text: In the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the Shephelah, and in the cities of the Negeb, in the land of Benjamin, the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, flocks shall again pass under the hands of the one who counts them, says the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:14
verses.text: "Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will fulfill the promise I made to the house of Israel and the house of Judah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:15
verses.text: In those days and at that time I will cause a righteous Branch to spring up for David, and he shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:16
verses.text: In those days Judah will be saved and Jerusalem will dwell securely. And this is the name by which it will be called: 'The LORD is our righteousness.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:17
verses.text: "For thus says the LORD: David shall never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel,

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:18
verses.text: and the Levitical priests shall never lack a man in my presence to offer burnt offerings, to burn grain offerings, and to make sacrifices forever."

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:19
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:20
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD: If you can break my covenant with the day and my covenant with the night, so that day and night will not come at their appointed time,

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:21
verses.text: then also my covenant with David my servant may be broken, so that he shall not have a son to reign on his throne, and my covenant with the Levitical priests my ministers.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:22
verses.text: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered and the sands of the sea cannot be measured, so I will multiply the offspring of David my servant, and the Levitical priests who minister to me."

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:23
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:24
verses.text: "Have you not observed that these people are saying, 'The LORD has rejected the two clans that he chose'? Thus they have despised my people so that they are no longer a nation in their sight.

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:25
verses.text: Thus says the LORD: If I have not established my covenant with day and night and the fixed order of heaven and earth,

verses.name: Jeremiah 33:26
verses.text: then I will reject the offspring of Jacob and David my servant and will not choose one of his offspring to rule over the offspring of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. For I will restore their fortunes and will have mercy on them."

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:1
verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army and all the kingdoms of the earth under his dominion and all the peoples were fighting against Jerusalem and all of its cities:

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:2
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and say to him, 'Thus says the LORD: Behold, I am giving this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:3
verses.text: You shall not escape from his hand but shall surely be captured and delivered into his hand. You shall see the king of Babylon eye to eye and speak with him face to face. And you shall go to Babylon.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:4
verses.text: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O Zedekiah king of Judah! Thus says the LORD concerning you: 'You shall not die by the sword.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:5
verses.text: You shall die in peace. And as spices were burned for your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so people shall burn spices for you and lament for you, saying, "Alas, lord!"'For I have spoken the word, declares the LORD."

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:6
verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah, in Jerusalem,

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:7
verses.text: when the army of the king of Babylon was fighting against Jerusalem and against all the cities of Judah that were left, Lachish and Azekah, for these were the only fortified cities of Judah that remained.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:8
verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to make a proclamation of liberty to them,

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:9
verses.text: that everyone should set free his Hebrew slaves, male and female, so that no one should enslave a Jew, his brother.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:10
verses.text: And they obeyed, all the officials and all the people who had entered into the covenant that everyone would set free his slave, male or female, so that they would not be enslaved again. They obeyed and set them free.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:11
verses.text: But afterward they turned around and took back the male and female slaves they had set free, and brought them into subjection as slaves.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:12
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:13
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: I myself made a covenant with your fathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying,

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:14
verses.text: 'At the end of seven years each of you must set free the fellow Hebrew who has been sold to you and has served you six years; you must set him free from your service.' But your fathers did not listen to me or incline their ears to me.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:15
verses.text: You recently repented and did what was right in my eyes by proclaiming liberty, each to his neighbor, and you made a covenant before me in the house that is called by my name,

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:16
verses.text: but then you turned around and profaned my name when each of you took back his male and female slaves, whom you had set free according to their desire, and you brought them into subjection to be your slaves.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:17
verses.text: "Therefore, thus says the LORD: You have not obeyed me by proclaiming liberty, every one to his brother and to his neighbor; behold, I proclaim to you liberty to the sword, to pestilence, and to famine, declares the LORD. I will make you a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:18
verses.text: And the men who transgressed my covenant and did not keep the terms of the covenant that they made before me, I will make them like the calf that they cut in two and passed between its parts-

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:19
verses.text: the officials of Judah, the officials of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, the priests, and all the people of the land who passed between the parts of the calf.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:20
verses.text: And I will give them into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their lives. Their dead bodies shall be food for the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:21
verses.text: And Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials I will give into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their lives, into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon which has withdrawn from you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 34:22
verses.text: Behold, I will command, declares the LORD, and will bring them back to this city. And they will fight against it and take it and burn it with fire. I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without inhabitant."

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:1
verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:2
verses.text: "Go to the house of the Rechabites and speak with them and bring them to the house of the LORD, into one of the chambers; then offer them wine to drink."

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:3
verses.text: So I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, son of Habazziniah and his brothers and all his sons and the whole house of the Rechabites.

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:4
verses.text: I brought them to the house of the LORD into the chamber of the sons of Hanan the son of Igdaliah, the man of God, which was near the chamber of the officials, above the chamber of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, keeper of the threshold.

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:5
verses.text: Then I set before the Rechabites pitchers full of wine, and cups, and I said to them, "Drink wine."

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:6
verses.text: But they answered, "We will drink no wine, for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, 'You shall not drink wine, neither you nor your sons forever.

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:7
verses.text: You shall not build a house; you shall not sow seed; you shall not plant or have a vineyard; but you shall live in tents all your days, that you may live many days in the land where you sojourn.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:8
verses.text: We have obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, in all that he commanded us, to drink no wine all our days, ourselves, our wives, our sons, or our daughters,

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:9
verses.text: and not to build houses to dwell in. We have no vineyard or field or seed,

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:10
verses.text: but we have lived in tents and have obeyed and done all that Jonadab our father commanded us.

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:11
verses.text: But when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against the land, we said, 'Come, and let us go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans and the army of the Syrians.' So we are living in Jerusalem."

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:12
verses.text: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:13
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Go and say to the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, Will you not receive instruction and listen to my words? declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:14
verses.text: The command that Jonadab the son of Rechab gave to his sons, to drink no wine, has been kept, and they drink none to this day, for they have obeyed their father's command. I have spoken to you persistently, but you have not listened to me.

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:15
verses.text: I have sent to you all my servants the prophets, sending them persistently, saying, 'Turn now every one of you from his evil way, and amend your deeds, and do not go after other gods to serve them, and then you shall dwell in the land that I gave to you and your fathers.' But you did not incline your ear or listen to me.

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:16
verses.text: The sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have kept the command that their father gave them, but this people has not obeyed me.

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:17
verses.text: Therefore, thus says the LORD, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am bringing upon Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the disaster that I have pronounced against them, because I have spoken to them and they have not listened, I have called to them and they have not answered."

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:18
verses.text: But to the house of the Rechabites Jeremiah said, "Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Because you have obeyed the command of Jonadab your father and kept all his precepts and done all that he commanded you,

verses.name: Jeremiah 35:19
verses.text: therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Jonadab the son of Rechab shall never lack a man to stand before me."

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:1
verses.text: In the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:2
verses.text: "Take a scroll and write on it all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel and Judah and all the nations, from the day I spoke to you, from the days of Josiah until today.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:3
verses.text: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the disaster that I intend to do to them, so that every one may turn from his evil way, and that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin."

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:4
verses.text: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah, and Baruch wrote on a scroll at the dictation of Jeremiah all the words of the LORD that he had spoken to him.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:5
verses.text: And Jeremiah ordered Baruch, saying, "I am banned from going to the house of the LORD,

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:6
verses.text: so you are to go, and on a day of fasting in the hearing of all the people in the LORD's house you shall read the words of the LORD from the scroll that you have written at my dictation. You shall read them also in the hearing of all the men of Judah who come out of their cities.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:7
verses.text: It may be that their plea for mercy will come before the LORD, and that every one will turn from his evil way, for great is the anger and wrath that the LORD has pronounced against this people."

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:8
verses.text: And Baruch the son of Neriah did all that Jeremiah the prophet ordered him about reading from the scroll the words of the LORD in the LORD's house.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:9
verses.text: In the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, all the people in Jerusalem and all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem proclaimed a fast before the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:10
verses.text: Then, in the hearing of all the people, Baruch read the words of Jeremiah from the scroll, in the house of the LORD, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the secretary, which was in the upper court, at the entry of the New Gate of the LORD's house.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:11
verses.text: When Micaiah the son of Gemariah, son of Shaphan, heard all the words of the LORD from the scroll,

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:12
verses.text: he went down to the king's house, into the secretary's chamber, and all the officials were sitting there: Elishama the secretary, Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, Elnathan the son of Achbor, Gemariah the son of Shaphan, Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the officials.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:13
verses.text: And Micaiah told them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the scroll in the hearing of the people.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:14
verses.text: Then all the officials sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, son of Shelemiah, son of Cushi, to say to Baruch, "Take in your hand the scroll that you read in the hearing of the people, and come." So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand and came to them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:15
verses.text: And they said to him, "Sit down and read it." So Baruch read it to them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:16
verses.text: When they heard all the words, they turned one to another in fear. And they said to Baruch, "We must report all these words to the king."

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:17
verses.text: Then they asked Baruch, "Tell us, please, how did you write all these words? Was it at his dictation?"

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:18
verses.text: Baruch answered them, "He dictated all these words to me, while I wrote them with ink on the scroll."

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:19
verses.text: Then the officials said to Baruch, "Go and hide, you and Jeremiah, and let no one know where you are."

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:20
verses.text: So they went into the court to the king, having put the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the secretary, and they reported all the words to the king.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:21
verses.text: Then the king sent Jehudi to get the scroll, and he took it from the chamber of Elishama the secretary. And Jehudi read it to the king and all the officials who stood beside the king.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:22
verses.text: It was the ninth month, and the king was sitting in the winter house, and there was a fire burning in the fire pot before him.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:23
verses.text: As Jehudi read three or four columns, the king would cut them off with a knife and throw them into the fire in the fire pot, until the entire scroll was consumed in the fire that was in the fire pot.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:24
verses.text: Yet neither the king nor any of his servants who heard all these words was afraid, nor did they tear their garments.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:25
verses.text: Even when Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah urged the king not to burn the scroll, he would not listen to them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:26
verses.text: And the king commanded Jerahmeel the king's son and Seraiah the son of Azriel and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel to seize Baruch the secretary and Jeremiah the prophet, but the LORD hid them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:27
verses.text: Now after the king had burned the scroll with the words that Baruch wrote at Jeremiah's dictation, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:28
verses.text: "Take another scroll and write on it all the former words that were in the first scroll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah has burned.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:29
verses.text: And concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah you shall say, 'Thus says the LORD, You have burned this scroll, saying, "Why have you written in it that the king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land, and will cut off from it man and beast?"

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:30
verses.text: Therefore thus says the LORD concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah: He shall have none to sit on the throne of David, and his dead body shall be cast out to the heat by day and the frost by night.

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:31
verses.text: And I will punish him and his offspring and his servants for their iniquity. I will bring upon them and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem and upon the people of Judah all the disaster that I have pronounced against them, but they would not hear.'"

verses.name: Jeremiah 36:32
verses.text: Then Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote on it at the dictation of Jeremiah all the words of the scroll that Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire. And many similar words were added to them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:1
verses.text: Zedekiah the son of Josiah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah, reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:2
verses.text: But neither he nor his servants nor the people of the land listened to the words of the LORD that he spoke through Jeremiah the prophet.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:3
verses.text: King Zedekiah sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah the priest, the son of Maaseiah, to Jeremiah the prophet, saying, "Please pray for us to the LORD our God."

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:4
verses.text: Now Jeremiah was still going in and out among the people, for he had not yet been put in prison.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:5
verses.text: The army of Pharaoh had come out of Egypt. And when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard news about them, they withdrew from Jerusalem.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:6
verses.text: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah the prophet:

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:7
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD, God of Israel: Thus shall you say to the king of Judah who sent you to me to inquire of me, 'Behold, Pharaoh's army that came to help you is about to return to Egypt, to its own land.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:8
verses.text: And the Chaldeans shall come back and fight against this city. They shall capture it and burn it with fire.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:9
verses.text: Thus says the LORD, Do not deceive yourselves, saying, "The Chaldeans will surely go away from us," for they will not go away.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:10
verses.text: For even if you should defeat the whole army of Chaldeans who are fighting against you, and there remained of them only wounded men, every man in his tent, they would rise up and burn this city with fire.'"

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:11
verses.text: Now when the Chaldean army had withdrawn from Jerusalem at the approach of Pharaoh's army,

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:12
verses.text: Jeremiah set out from Jerusalem to go to the land of Benjamin to receive his portion there among the people.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:13
verses.text: When he was at the Benjamin Gate, a sentry there named Irijah the son of Shelemiah, son of Hananiah, seized Jeremiah the prophet, saying, "You are deserting to the Chaldeans."

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:14
verses.text: And Jeremiah said, "It is a lie; I am not deserting to the Chaldeans." But Irijah would not listen to him, and seized Jeremiah and brought him to the officials.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:15
verses.text: And the officials were enraged at Jeremiah, and they beat him and imprisoned him in the house of Jonathan the secretary, for it had been made a prison.

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:16
verses.text: When Jeremiah had come to the dungeon cells and remained there many days,

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:17
verses.text: King Zedekiah sent for him and received him. The king questioned him secretly in his house and said, "Is there any word from the LORD?" Jeremiah said, "There is." Then he said, "You shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon."

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:18
verses.text: Jeremiah also said to King Zedekiah, "What wrong have I done to you or your servants or this people, that you have put me in prison?

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:19
verses.text: Where are your prophets who prophesied to you, saying, 'The king of Babylon will not come against you and against this land'?

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:20
verses.text: Now hear, please, O my lord the king: let my humble plea come before you and do not send me back to the house of Jonathan the secretary, lest I die there."

verses.name: Jeremiah 37:21
verses.text: So King Zedekiah gave orders, and they committed Jeremiah to the court of the guard. And a loaf of bread was given him daily from the bakers' street, until all the bread of the city was gone. So Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:1
verses.text: Now Shephatiah the son of Mattan, Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchiah heard the words that Jeremiah was saying to all the people,

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:2
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD: He who stays in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence, but he who goes out to the Chaldeans shall live. He shall have his life as a prize of war, and live.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:3
verses.text: Thus says the LORD: This city shall surely be given into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon and be taken."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:4
verses.text: Then the officials said to the king, "Let this man be put to death, for he is weakening the hands of the soldiers who are left in this city, and the hands of all the people, by speaking such words to them. For this man is not seeking the welfare of this people, but their harm."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:5
verses.text: King Zedekiah said, "Behold, he is in your hands, for the king can do nothing against you."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:6
verses.text: So they took Jeremiah and cast him into the cistern of Malchiah, the king's son, which was in the court of the guard, letting Jeremiah down by ropes. And there was no water in the cistern, but only mud, and Jeremiah sank in the mud.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:7
verses.text: When Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, a eunuch who was in the king's house, heard that they had put Jeremiah into the cistern- the king was sitting in the Benjamin Gate-

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:8
verses.text: Ebed-melech went from the king's house and said to the king,

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:9
verses.text: "My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they did to Jeremiah the prophet by casting him into the cistern, and he will die there of hunger, for there is no bread left in the city."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:10
verses.text: Then the king commanded Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, "Take three men with you from here, and lift Jeremiah the prophet out of the cistern before he dies."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:11
verses.text: So Ebed-melech took the men with him and went to the house of the king, to a wardrobe in the storehouse, and took from there old rags and worn-out clothes, which he let down to Jeremiah in the cistern by ropes.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:12
verses.text: Then Ebed-melech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah, "Put the rags and clothes between your armpits and the ropes." Jeremiah did so.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:13
verses.text: Then they drew Jeremiah up with ropes and lifted him out of the cistern. And Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:14
verses.text: King Zedekiah sent for Jeremiah the prophet and received him at the third entrance of the temple of the LORD. The king said to Jeremiah, "I will ask you a question; hide nothing from me."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:15
verses.text: Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, "If I tell you, will you not surely put me to death? And if I give you counsel, you will not listen to me."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:16
verses.text: Then King Zedekiah swore secretly to Jeremiah, "As the LORD lives, who made our souls, I will not put you to death or deliver you into the hand of these men who seek your life."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:17
verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, "Thus says the LORD, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: If you will surrender to the officials of the king of Babylon, then your life shall be spared, and this city shall not be burned with fire, and you and your house shall live.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:18
verses.text: But if you do not surrender to the officials of the king of Babylon, then this city shall be given into the hand of the Chaldeans, and they shall burn it with fire, and you shall not escape from their hand."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:19
verses.text: King Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, "I am afraid of the Judeans who have deserted to the Chaldeans, lest I be handed over to them and they deal cruelly with me."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:20
verses.text: Jeremiah said, "You shall not be given to them. Obey now the voice of the LORD in what I say to you, and it shall be well with you, and your life shall be spared.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:21
verses.text: But if you refuse to surrender, this is the vision which the LORD has shown to me:

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:22
verses.text: Behold, all the women left in the house of the king of Judah were being led out to the officials of the king of Babylon and were saying, "' Your trusted friends have deceived you and prevailed against you; now that your feet are sunk in the mud, they turn away from you.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:23
verses.text: All your wives and your sons shall be led out to the Chaldeans, and you yourself shall not escape from their hand, but shall be seized by the king of Babylon, and this city shall be burned with fire."

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:24
verses.text: Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, "Let no one know of these words, and you shall not die.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:25
verses.text: If the officials hear that I have spoken with you and come to you and say to you, 'Tell us what you said to the king and what the king said to you; hide nothing from us and we will not put you to death,'

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:26
verses.text: then you shall say to them, 'I made a humble plea to the king that he would not send me back to the house of Jonathan to die there.'"

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:27
verses.text: Then all the officials came to Jeremiah and asked him, and he answered them as the king had instructed him. So they stopped speaking with him, for the conversation had not been overheard.

verses.name: Jeremiah 38:28
verses.text: And Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard until the day that Jerusalem was taken.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:1
verses.text: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army came against Jerusalem and besieged it.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:2
verses.text: In the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, a breach was made in the city.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:3
verses.text: Then all the officials of the king of Babylon came and sat in the middle gate: Nergal-sar-ezer, Samgar-nebu, Sar-sekim the Rab-saris, Nergal-sar-ezer the Rab-mag, with all the rest of the officers of the king of Babylon.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:4
verses.text: When Zedekiah king of Judah and all the soldiers saw them, they fled, going out of the city at night by way of the king's garden through the gate between the two walls; and they went toward the Arabah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:5
verses.text: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued them and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. And when they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, at Riblah, in the land of Hamath; and he passed sentence on him.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:6
verses.text: The king of Babylon slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah at Riblah before his eyes, and the king of Babylon slaughtered all the nobles of Judah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:7
verses.text: He put out the eyes of Zedekiah and bound him in chains to take him to Babylon.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:8
verses.text: The Chaldeans burned the king's house and the house of the people, and broke down the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:9
verses.text: Then Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, carried into exile to Babylon the rest of the people who were left in the city, those who had deserted to him, and the people who remained.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:10
verses.text: Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, left in the land of Judah some of the poor people who owned nothing, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:11
verses.text: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon gave command concerning Jeremiah through Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, saying,

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:12
verses.text: "Take him, look after him well, and do him no harm, but deal with him as he tells you."

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:13
verses.text: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, Nebushazban the Rab-saris, Nergal-sar-ezer the Rab-mag, and all the chief officers of the king of Babylon

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:14
verses.text: sent and took Jeremiah from the court of the guard. They entrusted him to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, that he should take him home. So he lived among the people.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:15
verses.text: The word of the LORD came to Jeremiah while he was shut up in the court of the guard:

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:16
verses.text: "Go, and say to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, 'Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will fulfill my words against this city for harm and not for good, and they shall be accomplished before you on that day.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:17
verses.text: But I will deliver you on that day, declares the LORD, and you shall not be given into the hand of the men of whom you are afraid.

verses.name: Jeremiah 39:18
verses.text: For I will surely save you, and you shall not fall by the sword, but you shall have your life as a prize of war, because you have put your trust in me, declares the LORD.'"

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:1
verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD after Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he took him bound in chains along with all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah who were being exiled to Babylon.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:2
verses.text: The captain of the guard took Jeremiah and said to him, "The LORD your God pronounced this disaster against this place.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:3
verses.text: The LORD has brought it about, and has done as he said. Because you sinned against the LORD and did not obey his voice, this thing has come upon you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:4
verses.text: Now, behold, I release you today from the chains on your hands. If it seems good to you to come with me to Babylon, come, and I will look after you well, but if it seems wrong to you to come with me to Babylon, do not come. See, the whole land is before you; go wherever you think it good and right to go.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:5
verses.text: If you remain, then return to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon appointed governor of the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people. Or go wherever you think it right to go." So the captain of the guard gave him an allowance of food and a present, and let him go.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:6
verses.text: Then Jeremiah went to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, at Mizpah, and lived with him among the people who were left in the land.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:7
verses.text: When all the captains of the forces in the open country and their men heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor in the land and had committed to him men, women, and children, those of the poorest of the land who had not been taken into exile to Babylon,

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:8
verses.text: they went to Gedaliah at Mizpah- Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, Johanan the son of Kareah, Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, Jezaniah the son of the Maacathite, they and their men.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:9
verses.text: Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, swore to them and their men, saying, "Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:10
verses.text: As for me, I will dwell at Mizpah, to represent you before the Chaldeans who will come to us. But as for you, gather wine and summer fruits and oil, and store them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that you have taken."

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:11
verses.text: Likewise, when all the Judeans who were in Moab and among the Ammonites and in Edom and in other lands heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant in Judah and had appointed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, as governor over them,

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:12
verses.text: then all the Judeans returned from all the places to which they had been driven and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah. And they gathered wine and summer fruits in great abundance.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:13
verses.text: Now Johanan the son of Kareah and all the leaders of the forces in the open country came to Gedaliah at Mizpah

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:14
verses.text: and said to him, "Do you know that Baalis the king of the Ammonites has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to take your life?" But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam would not believe them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:15
verses.text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spoke secretly to Gedaliah at Mizpah, "Please let me go and strike down Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no one will know it. Why should he take your life, so that all the Judeans who are gathered about you would be scattered, and the remnant of Judah would perish?"

verses.name: Jeremiah 40:16
verses.text: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said to Johanan the son of Kareah, "You shall not do this thing, for you are speaking falsely of Ishmael."

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:1
verses.text: In the seventh month, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, son of Elishama, of the royal family, one of the chief officers of the king, came with ten men to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, at Mizpah. As they ate bread together there at Mizpah,

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:2
verses.text: Ishmael the son of Nethaniah and the ten men with him rose up and struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, with the sword, and killed him, whom the king of Babylon had appointed governor in the land.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:3
verses.text: Ishmael also struck down all the Judeans who were with Gedaliah at Mizpah, and the Chaldean soldiers who happened to be there.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:4
verses.text: On the day after the murder of Gedaliah, before anyone knew of it,

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:5
verses.text: eighty men arrived from Shechem and Shiloh and Samaria, with their beards shaved and their clothes torn, and their bodies gashed, bringing grain offerings and incense to present at the temple of the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:6
verses.text: And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah came out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he came. As he met them, he said to them, "Come in to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam."

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:7
verses.text: When they came into the city, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah and the men with him slaughtered them and cast them into a cistern.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:8
verses.text: But there were ten men among them who said to Ishmael, "Do not put us to death, for we have stores of wheat, barley, oil, and honey hidden in the fields." So he refrained and did not put them to death with their companions.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:9
verses.text: Now the cistern into which Ishmael had thrown all the bodies of the men whom he had struck down along with Gedaliah was the large cistern that King Asa had made for defense against Baasha king of Israel; Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:10
verses.text: Then Ishmael took captive all the rest of the people who were in Mizpah, the king's daughters and all the people who were left at Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam. Ishmael the son of Nethaniah took them captive and set out to cross over to the Ammonites.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:11
verses.text: But when Johanan the son of Kareah and all the leaders of the forces with him heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done,

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:12
verses.text: they took all their men and went to fight against Ishmael the son of Nethaniah. They came upon him at the great pool that is in Gibeon.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:13
verses.text: And when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah and all the leaders of the forces with him, they rejoiced.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:14
verses.text: So all the people whom Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah turned around and came back, and went to Johanan the son of Kareah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:15
verses.text: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the Ammonites.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:16
verses.text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah and all the leaders of the forces with him took from Mizpah all the rest of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, after he had struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam- soldiers, women, children, and eunuchs, whom Johanan brought back from Gibeon.

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:17
verses.text: And they went and stayed at Geruth Chimham near Bethlehem, intending to go to Egypt

verses.name: Jeremiah 41:18
verses.text: because of the Chaldeans. For they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:1
verses.text: Then all the commanders of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least to the greatest, came near

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:2
verses.text: and said to Jeremiah the prophet, "Let our plea for mercy come before you, and pray to the LORD your God for us, for all this remnant- because we are left with but a few, as your eyes see us-

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:3
verses.text: that the LORD your God may show us the way we should go, and the thing that we should do."

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:4
verses.text: Jeremiah the prophet said to them, "I have heard you. Behold, I will pray to the LORD your God according to your request, and whatever the LORD answers you I will tell you. I will keep nothing back from you."

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:5
verses.text: Then they said to Jeremiah, "May the LORD be a true and faithful witness against us if we do not act according to all the word with which the LORD your God sends you to us.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:6
verses.text: Whether it is good or bad, we will obey the voice of the LORD our God to whom we are sending you, that it may be well with us when we obey the voice of the LORD our God."

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:7
verses.text: At the end of ten days the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:8
verses.text: Then he summoned Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces who were with him, and all the people from the least to the greatest,

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:9
verses.text: and said to them, "Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your plea for mercy before him:

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:10
verses.text: If you will remain in this land, then I will build you up and not pull you down; I will plant you, and not pluck you up; for I relent of the disaster that I did to you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:11
verses.text: Do not fear the king of Babylon, of whom you are afraid. Do not fear him, declares the LORD, for I am with you, to save you and to deliver you from his hand.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:12
verses.text: I will grant you mercy, that he may have mercy on you and let you remain in your own land.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:13
verses.text: But if you say, 'We will not remain in this land,' disobeying the voice of the LORD your God

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:14
verses.text: and saying, 'No, we will go to the land of Egypt, where we shall not see war or hear the sound of the trumpet or be hungry for bread, and we will dwell there,'

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:15
verses.text: then hear the word of the LORD, O remnant of Judah. Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: If you set your faces to enter Egypt and go to live there,

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:16
verses.text: then the sword that you fear shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt, and the famine of which you are afraid shall follow close after you to Egypt, and there you shall die.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:17
verses.text: All the men who set their faces to go to Egypt to live there shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence. They shall have no remnant or survivor from the disaster that I will bring upon them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:18
verses.text: "For thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: As my anger and my wrath were poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so my wrath will be poured out on you when you go to Egypt. You shall become an execration, a horror, a curse, and a taunt. You shall see this place no more.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:19
verses.text: The LORD has said to you, O remnant of Judah, 'Do not go to Egypt.' Know for a certainty that I have warned you this day

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:20
verses.text: that you have gone astray at the cost of your lives. For you sent me to the LORD your God, saying, 'Pray for us to the LORD our God, and whatever the LORD our God says declare to us and we will do it.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:21
verses.text: And I have this day declared it to you, but you have not obeyed the voice of the LORD your God in anything that he sent me to tell you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 42:22
verses.text: Now therefore know for a certainty that you shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence in the place where you desire to go to live."

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:1
verses.text: When Jeremiah finished speaking to all the people all these words of the LORD their God, with which the LORD their God had sent him to them,

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:2
verses.text: Azariah the son of Hoshaiah and Johanan the son of Kareah and all the insolent men said to Jeremiah, "You are telling a lie. The LORD our God did not send you to say, 'Do not go to Egypt to live there,'

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:3
verses.text: but Baruch the son of Neriah has set you against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they may kill us or take us into exile in Babylon."

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:4
verses.text: So Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces and all the people did not obey the voice of the LORD, to remain in the land of Judah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:5
verses.text: But Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces took all the remnant of Judah who had returned to live in the land of Judah from all the nations to which they had been driven-

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:6
verses.text: the men, the women, the children, the princesses, and every person whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan; also Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch the son of Neriah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:7
verses.text: And they came into the land of Egypt, for they did not obey the voice of the LORD. And they arrived at Tahpanhes.

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:8
verses.text: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes:

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:9
verses.text: "Take in your hands large stones and hide them in the mortar in the pavement that is at the entrance to Pharaoh's palace in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah,

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:10
verses.text: and say to them, 'Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and I will set his throne above these stones that I have hidden, and he will spread his royal canopy over them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:11
verses.text: He shall come and strike the land of Egypt, giving over to the pestilence those who are doomed to the pestilence, to captivity those who are doomed to captivity, and to the sword those who are doomed to the sword.

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:12
verses.text: I shall kindle a fire in the temples of the gods of Egypt, and he shall burn them and carry them away captive. And he shall clean the land of Egypt as a shepherd cleans his cloak of vermin, and he shall go away from there in peace.

verses.name: Jeremiah 43:13
verses.text: He shall break the obelisks of Heliopolis, which is in the land of Egypt, and the temples of the gods of Egypt he shall burn with fire.'"

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:1
verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Judeans who lived in the land of Egypt, at Migdol, at Tahpanhes, at Memphis, and in the land of Pathros,

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:2
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: You have seen all the disaster that I brought upon Jerusalem and upon all the cities of Judah. Behold, this day they are a desolation, and no one dwells in them,

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:3
verses.text: because of the evil that they committed, provoking me to anger, in that they went to make offerings and serve other gods that they knew not, neither they, nor you, nor your fathers.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:4
verses.text: Yet I persistently sent to you all my servants the prophets, saying, 'Oh, do not do this abomination that I hate!'

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:5
verses.text: But they did not listen or incline their ear, to turn from their evil and make no offerings to other gods.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:6
verses.text: Therefore my wrath and my anger were poured out and kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, and they became a waste and a desolation, as at this day.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:7
verses.text: And now thus says the Lord GOD of hosts, the God of Israel: Why do you commit this great evil against yourselves, to cut off from you man and woman, infant and child, from the midst of Judah, leaving you no remnant?

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:8
verses.text: Why do you provoke me to anger with the works of your hands, making offerings to other gods in the land of Egypt where you have come to live, so that you may be cut off and become a curse and a taunt among all the nations of the earth?

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:9
verses.text: Have you forgotten the evil of your fathers, the evil of the kings of Judah, the evil of their wives, your own evil, and the evil of your wives, which they committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:10
verses.text: They have not humbled themselves even to this day, nor have they feared, nor walked in my law and my statutes that I set before you and before your fathers.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:11
verses.text: "Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will set my face against you for harm, to cut off all Judah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:12
verses.text: I will take the remnant of Judah who have set their faces to come to the land of Egypt to live, and they shall all be consumed. In the land of Egypt they shall fall; by the sword and by famine they shall be consumed. From the least to the greatest, they shall die by the sword and by famine, and they shall become an oath, a horror, a curse, and a taunt.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:13
verses.text: I will punish those who dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence,

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:14
verses.text: so that none of the remnant of Judah who have come to live in the land of Egypt shall escape or survive or return to the land of Judah, to which they desire to return to dwell there. For they shall not return, except some fugitives."

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:15
verses.text: Then all the men who knew that their wives had made offerings to other gods, and all the women who stood by, a great assembly, all the people who lived in Pathros in the land of Egypt, answered Jeremiah:

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:16
verses.text: "As for the word that you have spoken to us in the name of the LORD, we will not listen to you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:17
verses.text: But we will do everything that we have vowed, make offerings to the queen of heaven and pour out drink offerings to her, as we did, both we and our fathers, our kings and our officials, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. For then we had plenty of food, and prospered, and saw no disaster.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:18
verses.text: But since we left off making offerings to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything and have been consumed by the sword and by famine."

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:19
verses.text: And the women said, "When we made offerings to the queen of heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, was it without our husbands' approval that we made cakes for her bearing her image and poured out drink offerings to her?"

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:20
verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, men and women, all the people who had given him this answer:

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:21
verses.text: "As for the offerings that you offered in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, you and your fathers, your kings and your officials, and the people of the land, did not the LORD remember them? Did it not come into his mind?

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:22
verses.text: The LORD could no longer bear your evil deeds and the abominations that you committed. Therefore your land has become a desolation and a waste and a curse, without inhabitant, as it is this day.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:23
verses.text: It is because you made offerings and because you sinned against the LORD and did not obey the voice of the LORD or walk in his law and in his statutes and in his testimonies that this disaster has happened to you, as at this day."

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:24
verses.text: Jeremiah said to all the people and all the women, "Hear the word of the LORD, all you of Judah who are in the land of Egypt.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:25
verses.text: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: You and your wives have declared with your mouths, and have fulfilled it with your hands, saying, 'We will surely perform our vows that we have made, to make offerings to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink offerings to her.' Then confirm your vows and perform your vows!

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:26
verses.text: Therefore hear the word of the LORD, all you of Judah who dwell in the land of Egypt: Behold, I have sworn by my great name, says the LORD, that my name shall no more be invoked by the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, 'As the Lord GOD lives.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:27
verses.text: Behold, I am watching over them for disaster and not for good. All the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, until there is an end of them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:28
verses.text: And those who escape the sword shall return from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah, few in number; and all the remnant of Judah, who came to the land of Egypt to live, shall know whose word will stand, mine or theirs.

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:29
verses.text: This shall be the sign to you, declares the LORD, that I will punish you in this place, in order that you may know that my words will surely stand against you for harm:

verses.name: Jeremiah 44:30
verses.text: Thus says the LORD, behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies and into the hand of those who seek his life, as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who was his enemy and sought his life."

verses.name: Jeremiah 45:1
verses.text: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch the son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a book at the dictation of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:

verses.name: Jeremiah 45:2
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, to you, O Baruch:

verses.name: Jeremiah 45:3
verses.text: You said, 'Woe is me! For the LORD has added sorrow to my pain. I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 45:4
verses.text: Thus shall you say to him, Thus says the LORD: Behold, what I have built I am breaking down, and what I have planted I am plucking up- that is, the whole land.

verses.name: Jeremiah 45:5
verses.text: And do you seek great things for yourself? Seek them not, for behold, I am bringing disaster upon all flesh, declares the LORD. But I will give you your life as a prize of war in all places to which you may go."

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:2
verses.text: About Egypt. Concerning the army of Pharaoh Neco, king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates at Carchemish and which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:3
verses.text: "Prepare buckler and shield, and advance for battle!

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:4
verses.text: Harness the horses; mount, O horsemen! Take your stations with your helmets, polish your spears, put on your armor!

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:5
verses.text: Why have I seen it? They are dismayed and have turned backward. Their warriors are beaten down and have fled in haste; they look not back- terror on every side! declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:6
verses.text: The swift cannot flee away, nor the warrior escape; in the north by the river Euphrates they have stumbled and fallen.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:7
verses.text: "Who is this, rising like the Nile, like rivers whose waters surge?

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:8
verses.text: Egypt rises like the Nile, like rivers whose waters surge. He said, 'I will rise, I will cover the earth, I will destroy cities and their inhabitants.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:9
verses.text: Advance, O horses, and rage, O chariots! Let the warriors go out: men of Cush and Put who handle the shield, men of Lud, skilled in handling the bow.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:10
verses.text: That day is the day of the Lord GOD of hosts, a day of vengeance, to avenge himself on his foes. The sword shall devour and be sated and drink its fill of their blood. For the Lord GOD of hosts holds a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:11
verses.text: Go up to Gilead, and take balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt! In vain you have used many medicines; there is no healing for you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:12
verses.text: The nations have heard of your shame, and the earth is full of your cry; for warrior has stumbled against warrior; they have both fallen together."

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:13
verses.text: The word that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to strike the land of Egypt:

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:14
verses.text: "Declare in Egypt, and proclaim in Migdol; proclaim in Memphis and Tahpanhes; Say, 'Stand ready and be prepared, for the sword shall devour around you.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:15
verses.text: Why are your mighty ones face down? They do not stand because the LORD thrust them down.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:16
verses.text: He made many stumble, and they fell, and they said one to another, 'Arise, and let us go back to our own people and to the land of our birth, because of the sword of the oppressor.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:17
verses.text: Call the name of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, 'Noisy one who lets the hour go by.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:18
verses.text: "As I live, declares the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts, like Tabor among the mountains and like Carmel by the sea, shall one come.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:19
verses.text: Prepare yourselves baggage for exile, O inhabitants of Egypt! For Memphis shall become a waste, a ruin, without inhabitant.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:20
verses.text: "A beautiful heifer is Egypt, but a biting fly from the north has come upon her.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:21
verses.text: Even her hired soldiers in her midst are like fattened calves; yes, they have turned and fled together; they did not stand, for the day of their calamity has come upon them, the time of their punishment.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:22
verses.text: "She makes a sound like a serpent gliding away; for her enemies march in force and come against her with axes like those who fell trees.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:23
verses.text: They shall cut down her forest, declares the LORD, though it is impenetrable, because they are more numerous than locusts; they are without number.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:24
verses.text: The daughter of Egypt shall be put to shame; she shall be delivered into the hand of a people from the north."

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:25
verses.text: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, said: "Behold, I am bringing punishment upon Amon of Thebes, and Pharaoh and Egypt and her gods and her kings, upon Pharaoh and those who trust in him.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:26
verses.text: I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their life, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his officers. Afterward Egypt shall be inhabited as in the days of old, declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:27
verses.text: "But fear not, O Jacob my servant, nor be dismayed, O Israel, for behold, I will save you from far away, and your offspring from the land of their captivity. Jacob shall return and have quiet and ease, and none shall make him afraid.

verses.name: Jeremiah 46:28
verses.text: Fear not, O Jacob my servant, declares the LORD, for I am with you. I will make a full end of all the nations to which I have driven you, but of you I will not make a full end. I will discipline you in just measure, and I will by no means leave you unpunished."

verses.name: Jeremiah 47:1
verses.text: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh struck down Gaza.

verses.name: Jeremiah 47:2
verses.text: "Thus says the LORD: Behold, waters are rising out of the north, and shall become an overflowing torrent; they shall overflow the land and all that fills it, the city and those who dwell in it. Men shall cry out, and every inhabitant of the land shall wail.

verses.name: Jeremiah 47:3
verses.text: At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his stallions, at the rushing of his chariots, at the rumbling of their wheels, the fathers look not back to their children, so feeble are their hands,

verses.name: Jeremiah 47:4
verses.text: because of the day that is coming to destroy all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and Sidon every helper that remains. For the LORD is destroying the Philistines, the remnant of the coastland of Caphtor.

verses.name: Jeremiah 47:5
verses.text: Baldness has come upon Gaza; Ashkelon has perished. O remnant of their valley, how long will you gash yourselves?

verses.name: Jeremiah 47:6
verses.text: Ah, sword of the LORD! How long till you are quiet? Put yourself into your scabbard; rest and be still!

verses.name: Jeremiah 47:7
verses.text: How can it be quiet when the LORD has given it a charge? Against Ashkelon and against the seashore he has appointed it."

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:1
verses.text: Concerning Moab.Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: "Woe to Nebo, for it is laid waste! Kiriathaim is put to shame, it is taken; the fortress is put to shame and broken down;

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:2
verses.text: the renown of Moab is no more. In Heshbon they planned disaster against her: 'Come, let us cut her off from being a nation!' You also, O Madmen, shall be brought to silence; the sword shall pursue you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:3
verses.text: "Hark! A cry from Horonaim, 'Desolation and great destruction!'

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:4
verses.text: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have made a cry.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:5
verses.text: For at the ascent of Luhith they go up weeping; for at the descent of Horonaim they have heard the distressed cry of destruction.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:6
verses.text: Flee! Save yourselves! You will be like a juniper in the desert!

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:7
verses.text: For, because you trusted in your works and your treasures, you also shall be taken; and Chemosh shall go into exile with his priests and his officials.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:8
verses.text: The destroyer shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape; the valley shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed, as the LORD has spoken.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:9
verses.text: "Give wings to Moab, for she would fly away; her cities shall become a desolation, with no inhabitant in them.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:10
verses.text: "Cursed is he who does the work of the LORD with slackness, and cursed is he who keeps back his sword from bloodshed.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:11
verses.text: "Moab has been at ease from his youth and has settled on his dregs; he has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, nor has he gone into exile; so his taste remains in him, and his scent is not changed.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:12
verses.text: "Therefore, behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I shall send to him pourers who will pour him, and empty his vessels and break his jars in pieces.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:13
verses.text: Then Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:14
verses.text: "How do you say, 'We are heroes and mighty men of war'?

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:15
verses.text: The destroyer of Moab and his cities has come up, and the choicest of his young men have gone down to slaughter, declares the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:16
verses.text: The calamity of Moab is near at hand, and his affliction hastens swiftly.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:17
verses.text: Grieve for him, all you who are around him, and all who know his name; say, 'How the mighty scepter is broken, the glorious staff.'

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:18
verses.text: "Come down from your glory, and sit on the parched ground, O inhabitant of Dibon! For the destroyer of Moab has come up against you; he has destroyed your strongholds.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:19
verses.text: Stand by the way and watch, O inhabitant of Aroer! Ask him who flees and her who escapes; say, 'What has happened?'

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:20
verses.text: Moab is put to shame, for it is broken; wail and cry! Tell it beside the Arnon, that Moab is laid waste.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:21
verses.text: "Judgment has come upon the tableland, upon Holon, and Jahzah, and Mephaath,

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:22
verses.text: and Dibon, and Nebo, and Beth-diblathaim,

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:23
verses.text: and Kiriathaim, and Beth-gamul, and Beth-meon,

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:24
verses.text: and Kerioth, and Bozrah, and all the cities of the land of Moab, far and near.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:25
verses.text: The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:26
verses.text: "Make him drunk, because he magnified himself against the LORD, so that Moab shall wallow in his vomit, and he too shall be held in derision.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:27
verses.text: Was not Israel a derision to you? Was he found among thieves, that whenever you spoke of him you wagged your head?

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:28
verses.text: "Leave the cities, and dwell in the rock, O inhabitants of Moab! Be like the dove that nests in the sides of the mouth of a gorge.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:29
verses.text: We have heard of the pride of Moab- he is very proud- of his loftiness, his pride, and his arrogance, and the haughtiness of his heart.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:30
verses.text: I know his insolence, declares the LORD; his boasts are false, his deeds are false.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:31
verses.text: Therefore I wail for Moab; I cry out for all Moab; for the men of Kir-hareseth I mourn.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:32
verses.text: More than for Jazer I weep for you, O vine of Sibmah! Your branches passed over the sea, reached to the Sea of Jazer; on your summer fruits and your grapes the destroyer has fallen.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:33
verses.text: Gladness and joy have been taken away from the fruitful land of Moab; I have made the wine cease from the wine presses; no one treads them with shouts of joy; the shouting is not the shout of joy.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:34
verses.text: "From the outcry at Heshbon even to Elealeh, as far as Jahaz they utter their voice, from Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath-shelishiyah. For the waters of Nimrim also have become desolate.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:35
verses.text: And I will bring to an end in Moab, declares the LORD, him who offers sacrifice in the high place and makes offerings to his god.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:36
verses.text: Therefore my heart moans for Moab like a flute, and my heart moans like a flute for the men of Kir-hareseth. Therefore the riches they gained have perished.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:37
verses.text: "For every head is shaved and every beard cut off. On all the hands are gashes, and around the waist is sackcloth.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:38
verses.text: On all the housetops of Moab and in the squares there is nothing but lamentation, for I have broken Moab like a vessel for which no one cares, declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:39
verses.text: How it is broken! How they wail! How Moab has turned his back in shame! So Moab has become a derision and a horror to all that are around him."

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:40
verses.text: For thus says the LORD: "Behold, one shall fly swiftly like an eagle and spread his wings against Moab;

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:41
verses.text: the cities shall be taken and the strongholds seized. The heart of the warriors of Moab shall be in that day like the heart of a woman in her birth pains;

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:42
verses.text: Moab shall be destroyed and be no longer a people, because he magnified himself against the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:43
verses.text: Terror, pit, and snare are before you, O inhabitant of Moab! declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:44
verses.text: He who flees from the terror shall fall into the pit, and he who climbs out of the pit shall be caught in the snare. For I will bring these things upon Moab, the year of their punishment, declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:45
verses.text: "In the shadow of Heshbon fugitives stop without strength, for fire came out from Heshbon, flame from the house of Sihon; it has destroyed the forehead of Moab, the crown of the sons of tumult.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:46
verses.text: Woe to you, O Moab! The people of Chemosh are undone, for your sons have been taken captive, and your daughters into captivity.

verses.name: Jeremiah 48:47
verses.text: Yet I will restore the fortunes of Moab in the latter days, declares the LORD." Thus far is the judgment on Moab.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:1
verses.text: Concerning the Ammonites.Thus says the LORD: "Has Israel no sons? Has he no heir? Why then has Milcom dispossessed Gad, and his people settled in its cities?

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:2
verses.text: Therefore, behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will cause the battle cry to be heard against Rabbah of the Ammonites; it shall become a desolate mound, and its villages shall be burned with fire; then Israel shall dispossess those who dispossessed him, says the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:3
verses.text: "Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai is laid waste! Cry out, O daughters of Rabbah! put on sackcloth, lament, and run to and fro among the hedges! For Milcom shall go into exile, with his priests and his officials.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:4
verses.text: Why do you boast of your valleys, O faithless daughter, who trusted in her treasures, saying, 'Who will come against me?'

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:5
verses.text: Behold, I will bring terror upon you, declares the Lord GOD of hosts, from all who are around you, and you shall be driven out, every man straight before him, with none to gather the fugitives.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:6
verses.text: "But afterward I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites, declares the LORD."

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:7
verses.text: Concerning Edom. Thus says the LORD of hosts: "Is wisdom no more in Teman? Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom vanished?

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:8
verses.text: Flee, turn back, dwell in the depths, O inhabitants of Dedan! For I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time when I punish him.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:9
verses.text: If grape-gatherers came to you, would they not leave gleanings? If thieves came by night, would they not destroy only enough for themselves?

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:10
verses.text: But I have stripped Esau bare; I have uncovered his hiding places, and he is not able to conceal himself. His children are destroyed, and his brothers, and his neighbors; and he is no more.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:11
verses.text: Leave your fatherless children; I will keep them alive; and let your widows trust in me."

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:12
verses.text: For thus says the LORD: "If those who did not deserve to drink the cup must drink it, will you go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished, but you must drink.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:13
verses.text: For I have sworn by myself, declares the LORD, that Bozrah shall become a horror, a taunt, a waste, and a curse, and all her cities shall be perpetual wastes."

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:14
verses.text: I have heard a message from the LORD, and an envoy has been sent among the nations: "Gather yourselves together and come against her, and rise up for battle!

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:15
verses.text: For behold, I will make you small among the nations, despised among mankind.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:16
verses.text: The horror you inspire has deceived you, and the pride of your heart, you who live in the clefts of the rock, who hold the height of the hill. Though you make your nest as high as the eagle's, I will bring you down from there, declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:17
verses.text: "Edom shall become a horror. Everyone who passes by it will be horrified and will hiss because of all its disasters.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:18
verses.text: As when Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring cities were overthrown, says the LORD, no man shall dwell there, no man shall sojourn in her.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:19
verses.text: Behold, like a lion coming up from the jungle of the Jordan against a perennial pasture, I will suddenly make him run away from her. And I will appoint over her whomever I choose. For who is like me? Who will summon me? What shepherd can stand before me?

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:20
verses.text: Therefore hear the plan that the LORD has made against Edom and the purposes that he has formed against the inhabitants of Teman: Even the little ones of the flock shall be dragged away. Surely their fold shall be appalled at their fate.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:21
verses.text: At the sound of their fall the earth shall tremble; the sound of their cry shall be heard at the Red Sea.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:22
verses.text: Behold, one shall mount up and fly swiftly like an eagle and spread his wings against Bozrah, and the heart of the warriors of Edom shall be in that day like the heart of a woman in her birth pains."

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:23
verses.text: Concerning Damascus: "Hamath and Arpad are confounded, for they have heard bad news; they melt in fear, they are troubled like the sea that cannot be quiet.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:24
verses.text: Damascus has become feeble, she turned to flee, and panic seized her; anguish and sorrows have taken hold of her, as of a woman in labor.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:25
verses.text: How is the famous city not forsaken, the city of my joy?

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:26
verses.text: Therefore her young men shall fall in her squares, and all her soldiers shall be destroyed in that day, declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:27
verses.text: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall devour the strongholds of Ben-hadad."

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:28
verses.text: Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck down. Thus says the LORD: "Rise up, advance against Kedar! Destroy the people of the east!

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:29
verses.text: Their tents and their flocks shall be taken, their curtains and all their goods; their camels shall be led away from them, and men shall cry to them: 'Terror on every side!'

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:30
verses.text: Flee, wander far away, dwell in the depths, O inhabitants of Hazor! declares the LORD. For Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has made a plan against you and formed a purpose against you.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:31
verses.text: "Rise up, advance against a nation at ease, that dwells securely, declares the LORD, that has no gates or bars, that dwells alone.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:32
verses.text: Their camels shall become plunder, their herds of livestock a spoil. I will scatter to every wind those who cut the corners of their hair, and I will bring their calamity from every side of them, declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:33
verses.text: Hazor shall become a haunt of jackals, an everlasting waste; no man shall dwell there; no man shall sojourn in her."

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:34
verses.text: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:35
verses.text: Thus says the LORD of hosts: "Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the mainstay of their might.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:36
verses.text: And I will bring upon Elam the four winds from the four quarters of heaven. And I will scatter them to all those winds, and there shall be no nation to which those driven out of Elam shall not come.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:37
verses.text: I will terrify Elam before their enemies and before those who seek their life. I will bring disaster upon them, my fierce anger, declares the LORD. I will send the sword after them, until I have consumed them,

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:38
verses.text: and I will set my throne in Elam and destroy their king and officials, declares the LORD.

verses.name: Jeremiah 49:39
verses.text: "But in the latter days I will restore the fortunes of Elam, declares the LORD."

verses.name: Jeremiah 50:1
